fileServer

Interface IServe

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileServer

    public interface IServe
    This interface is designed to allow HTTP requests interpreted by the Request Handler to be carried out.

    Each method returns an array of bytes. If we used Strings instead, our server would be restricted to serving ASCII files only (or at least whatever charset is supported by Java String Objects). By using an array of bytes, we can return any arbitrary string of zeros and ones, which could perhaps represent a JPEG image or compiled executable.

    Since:
    2012/09/03
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    G52APR

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      byte[] httpPOST(java.lang.String requestURI, byte[] postData) 

    • Method Detail

      • httpGet

        byte[] httpGet(java.lang.String requestURI)
               throws HTTPFileNotFoundException,
                      HTTPRuntimeException,
                      HTTPPermissionDeniedException
        Parameters:
        requestURI - the Request-URI from the associated GET request
        Returns:
        an array of bytes containing the requested data
        Throws:
        HTTPFileNotFoundException - if the file specified by the Request-URI does not exist
        HTTPRuntimeException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is executable but did not execute correctly
        HTTPPermissionDeniedException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is not permissioned correctly for read or execution access (as appropriate)

      • httpGETconditional

        byte[] httpGETconditional(java.lang.String requestURI,
                        java.util.Date ifModifiedSince)
                          throws HTTPFileNotFoundException,
                                 HTTPRuntimeException,
                                 HTTPPermissionDeniedException
        Parameters:
        requestURI - the Request-URI from the associated conditional GET request
        ifModifiedSince - a Date Object containing the date from the If-Modified-Since header field
        Returns:
        an array of bytes containing the requested data
        Throws:
        HTTPFileNotFoundException - if the file specified by the Request-URI does not exist
        HTTPRuntimeException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is executable but did not execute correctly
        HTTPPermissionDeniedException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is not permissioned correctly for read or execution access (as appropriate)

      • httpPOST

        byte[] httpPOST(java.lang.String requestURI,
              byte[] postData)
                throws HTTPFileNotFoundException,
                       HTTPRuntimeException,
                       HTTPPermissionDeniedException
        Parameters:
        requestURI - the Request-URI from the associated POST request
        postData - an array of bytes containing the POST data from the POST request
        Returns:
        an array of bytes containing the requested data
        Throws:
        HTTPFileNotFoundException - if the file specified by the Request-URI does not exist
        HTTPRuntimeException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is executable but did not execute correctly
        HTTPPermissionDeniedException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is not permissioned correctly for read or execution access (as appropriate)
